article.title: 10 Of The Best Things To Do In Budapest At Night!
article.lead_paragraph: Heading to Budapest for a weekend and don't know where to start? Many visitors are just now catching on to the architectural and historical wonder that is Budapest! We can help you in indulging their spa culture, history, architecture, ruin pubs or taking in a traditional Hungarian opera! Look no further - we have compiled the best ways to spend some time in the stunning Hungarian capitol at night!
article.proposal:
1. Szechenyi Spa Bath
2. Cruise along the Danube river 
3.  Hungarian State Opera House
4. Go drinking/partying in the ruin area
5.  Drink some coffee with the coffee snobs of Hungary
6.  Walk along the water/bridges
article.meta_description: Heading to Budapest for a weekend and no clue where to start? Look no further - we have complied the best ways to spend some time in the beautiful Hungarian capitol!

snippets.title: 1. Szechenyi Spa Bath
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/SzechenyiBath/photos/a.360951893980354.83417.360947697314107/511356438939898/?type=1&theater

Looking for a relaxing way to spend an evening in Budapest? Take part in this traditional Hungarian past time of going to a famous spa bath. Think huge tubs to choose from, lots of people resting and relaxing in jacuzzis, and snack bars to hang out at, all while making some new Hungarian friends! 

Speaking of making new friends, this spa offers occasional (and popular) pool parties here as well, if you are willing to pay the 55 USD price ticket, just check their website beforehand for the available dates on offer and to book online. You can also enter the spa for the day (no pool party but still relaxing!) for around 20 USD. Don't forget to take some pictures of this building while you visit, it's a famous historical gem and easy on the eyes!

> #### Szechenyi Spa Bath
>
> **Address**:  Állatkerti krt. 9-11, 1146 Hungary, Budapest
>
> **Website**: [Szechenyi Spa Bath](http://szechenyispabaths.com)

snippets.title: 2. Buda Castle
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=1661850707175811&set=br.AbqVGoVE6skZZrjoPISKzVbz-1p_Wxo-H1UGgApraCS_JWFr4DCv3JDUiiY4gAy-Lq-5sImF9aj7Y__zPeFMYVgDLZqd6oqrRuWj6RilkwtDwakUl79DRleNwbI51tYIgEbQRBN4uJlD1atNY38O23lZHA4NtpysZJES1VMRMWYshTXgiZRj_M0SRZu4h4_V9bDsVcPVDa81iCSMlZkbNSvTckMtUkkOO34hb7Z8tJrsx_uK-QEoLPimsK_F7WGcsYE&type=3&theater

Everyone has heard of this famous building, set on the river, and very picturesque. You can head here in the early morning hours, or at sunset for breathtaking photo ops, or come during open hours for a guided historical tour. The castle holds different types of festivals year round (check their calendar to plan your trip accordingly), as well as restaurants, museums, and a church! For budget lovers, taking a walk around the castle grounds is free and really something to see. A family, friends or a couple who love history, art and exploring can easily spend a whole day here!


> #### Buda Castle
>
> **Address**:  Szent György tér 2, 1014 Hungary
>
> **Website**: [Buda Castle](http://budacastlebudapest.com/)

snippets.title: 3. Hősök Tere
snippets.description:
A famous landmark in Budapest, this square remains a local and tourist favorite. If you love history, monuments and statues this is a great area to explore and take some pictures. The tomb of the unknown soldier is held here as well as two of Hungry's biggest art museums for art and culture lovers! 

> #### Hősök Tere
>
> **Address**:  Hősök Tere, 1146 Hungary

snippets.title: 4. Hungarian State Opera House
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/Operahaz/photos/a.386893123180.167091.248415223180/10154538797068181/?type=3&theater

Looking to pop some culture and arts into your visit? Head to the famous State Opera House to get your theater fix. Here you can sample an array of productions from recitals or ballets, to festivals and live music productions. Head to their website to check out the newest local plays as well as traveling stage productions.

> #### Hungarian State Opera House
>
> **Address**: Andrássy út 22, 1061 Hungary
>
> **Website**: [Hungarian State Opera House](http://www.opera.hu/)

snippets.title: 5. Ruin Pubs
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/ruinpubsinfo/photos/a.111015479257675.1073741826.111008995924990/344227889269765/?type=1&theater

What better way to spend an evening than walking through Hungry's oldest and most treasured area of Budapest? The Ruin Pub area is as you guessed, full of 'Pubs in Ruins', however it is so much more than meets the eye! The buildings have been preserved and are older, but still, maintain their character and uniqueness. 

Now known as the party area of Budapest, travelers and young people alike flock to this area to drink and party, but also to check out the latest vintage clothes, trendy boutique hotels and farmers markets on the weekends. The main party area is very small and composed of some famous locals bars, but feel encouraged to explore further than the small area - you may easily find the next hidden Budapest hot spot!

> #### Ruin Pubs
>
> **Address**:  Kazinczy u. 14, 1075 Hungary
>
> **Website**: [Ruin Pubs](http://ruinpubs.com/)

snippets.title: 6. Dabble in the coffee culture
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/EspressoEmbassy/photos/a.547808691901753.140398.547804408568848/1742050825810861/?type=1&theater

An up and coming scene is Budapest is its growing snob coffee culture. Hit up one of their speciality coffee shops, one of our favorites being, Espresso Embassy. Pretend you're a tight pants wearing hipster - or actually being one yourself, will earn you a gold star at this coffee shop! Expect high-quality coffee, a friendly staff, a cool atmosphere and place to hangout - but don't worry about the price tag. Budapest stills ranks as one of the most affordable coffee cities in Europe. This spot is no exception. Stop in to grab some quality caffeine for the road!


> #### Espresso Embassy
>
> **Address**:  Arany János u. 15, 1051 Hungary
>
> **Website**: [Espresso Embassy](http://espressoembassy.hu/)

snippets.title: 7. Walk along the Chain Bridge
snippets.description:
A great place to spend an early morning, afternoon or evening is walking along one of Hungry's most beloved bridges, the Chain Bridge. From here you get an amazing view of the parliament buildings, the water below, and castle hill. Perfect for photo taking, an early morning walk with no one around, or just a simple and easy connection driving or walking from West Budapest to East Budapest.

> #### Chain Bridge
>
> **Address**:  Széchenyi Lánchíd, 1051 Hungary

snippets.title: 8. St. Stephen's Basilica
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=1390095134393441&set=br.AbqyamKFeC9E8RkLaq8hPCxlmV3_gcDUOmIGVWPo32-o2AYH9QGbNcvZbW3feuSpkYo2SGBoL2tJLValhdx7ti4Z0z4YYkyojBqo7aJf-fzqjuATaytn6XuqrwjfAom4aLm53_4KL5LnLFgxj_71p9jH7YDGTaj9JjorwIKvG88IuacoPqje05X9SRlWZF5PPOYLDNFOyxz-gp98l9iJTOVG4BEs9zUvl6FLrS7ggItaBy34bhoYo-7rgnEbaaI3E5c&type=3&theater

St. Stephen's Basilica is the most famous Roman Catholic basilica in Budapest, Hungary. It is named after Stephen, the first King of Hungary, whose right hand is supposedly housed inside the building for safe keeping! The outside is a well known architectural gem, the inside is a very famous and beautifully decorated Catholic church as well as a coveted concert hall. Multiple famous Hungarian musicians have played here since the early 1900s and the tradition continues today!

> #### St. Stephen's Basilica
>
> **Address**:  Szent István tér 1, 1051 Hungary
>
> **Website**: [St. Stephen's Basilica](http://en.bazilika.biz/)

snippets.title: 9. Fisherman's Bastion
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10158527477715696&set=br.AbqpjVY5stezP4xBi0XlanH5zxl0SWC_dHsPUN_jpBnqxNgWtu958w6p_K8RCYHODt3qI95dqy3s_NzGyi3xulb9xaWPplRAo__uJ3Vy6zvBO_iwX-0Iv0tjcFH0GGJSrgT2ZVXLcvwHdqIRNL-g7j3QfGM_eNlzNs8C7eFzS7EWUPHQQkMLdxl6QnDSPchvsqyGac9218F-2YqLRhFxBpcLFBmiVUSnBAWtOCmdm98MvzmEPL0EH9M4sWQi9Le8IBI&type=3&theater

Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful fairy tale-like architectural gem in Budapest. Many tourists flock here for picture taking, and really just to see the spectacle of the view. You can have a stroll around the area, or even enjoy a coffee along the bridge up top for the best view of Budapest below!

> #### Fisherman's Bastion
>
> **Address**: Szentháromság tér, 1014 Hungary
>
> **Website**: [Fisherman's Bastion](http://www.fishermansbastion.com/)

snippets.title: 10. Cruise down the Danube
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10210343454976463&set=br.AbqAdIqHjUCVoMvpEOM9etmXoZYf0GclRh4o1I7XZ63RTW4x2rFLyFLYaZLbhjuaRV1xOWMgD3tmoHfk_K-H9ZtN16QdCn7bJ0Ql35TIcM8N5vbX85CcwPk8RXnrrmh5r-IG-xyNGycMA7RRVu2hNqYiZ_uxiNlIyzSz3gZr2aqvCGDT7FPu5MxCsxpEt2gdKWuaq-YcmhMaMRUjm-Y5fL1pTDccHD5lrsQR5DmNoY-7-vVH9dyUG5XJHh9XdIqbNdg&type=3&theater

What better way to get to know Budapest then to see it from the water? Budapest has a long reputation of beautiful sunsets as well as luxury day cruising options. If your budget allows it, then head to the Budapest river cruise website and book a lunch or dinner cruise on the Danube! Relax while sipping Hungarian wine, eating traditional Hungarian food and making some new friends on board!

> #### Budapest River Cruise
>
> **Address**:  Danube Riverfront
>
> **Website**: [Budapest River Cruise](http://budapestrivercruise.com)

snippets.title: Budapest is filled with fun and excitement!
snippets.title_with_numbering: Budapest is filled with fun and excitement!
snippets.description: We hope you had as great a time in the unique capitol of Budapest as we did! There is so much to see and do, the list is really endless. Our journey above is just a glimpse into the Hungarian traditions and wonder that capture more and more visitors every year to Budapest.

lead_paragraph_embed.value: Heading to Budapest for a weekend and don't know where to start? Many visitors are just now catching on to the architectural and historical wonder that is Budapest! We can help you in indulging their spa culture, history, architecture, ruin pubs or taking in a traditional Hungarian opera! Look no further - we have compiled the best ways to spend some time in the stunning Hungarian capitol at night!

article.guidelines:
##### 1. For listings WITH partner links (getyourguide / viator / klook): 

Category: Things to do 

Tags: things to do

Paragraph Headings: 

- Create a creative and catchy heading for the activity. 

- Example: "North-end Boston secret food tour" should be changed to something like "Indulge in some delicious local fare".

Photos: Not required*

Snippets: Not required*

*Ensure the tour link is copy/pasted in the partner link field for each section


##### 2. For listings WITHOUT partner links:

Category: Things to do 

Tags: things to do

Paragraph Headings: 

- Create a creative and catchy heading for the activity. 

- Example: "North-end Boston secret food tour" should be changed to something like "Indulge in some delicious local fare".

Photos: 
- Include relevant royalty-free / social media photos

- Upload 1 relevant royalty-free image (non-social media image) in the conclusion paragraph to use as the article's main image (ONLY if all listings have social media images)

- Refer to this tutorial guide: http://bit.ly/imagetutorialguide

Snippets: 

- Insert the "Things to do / Tours / Attractions" snippet manually at the end of each listing's paragraph and edit the information accordingly.

navigator.introduction: I am originally from New Jersey, went to college in New York City, and have since lived in Chicago, Las Vegas, Sydney, Prague and now Daegu, South Korea. I love exploring new places, learning new languages, writing and working out. I am an avid reader and traveler. I have been to over 30 countries, on 3 continents and can speak English, advanced Spanish and intermediate Czech. I love writing, I always have, and I look forward to sharing all of my travel secrets here with you on this blog!
